title: This incredible Alvaro Morata goal shows why Arsenal and Chelsea are so keen on the Real Madrid forward
text:
Sport This incredible Alvaro Morata goal shows why Arsenal and Chelsea are so keen on the Real Madrid forward The Spaniard will reportedly leave the Bernabeu at the end of the season if Zinedine Zidane is still in charge Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Alvaro Morata with incredible training ground goal Share this video Get     
Alvaro Morata has caught the eye of Premier League heavyweights Arsenal and Chelsea. 
The above video should explain why. 
The clip shows the Real Madrid forward on a Ciudad training pitch running towards a ball falling just outside the area. 
The 24-year-old catches it on the volley and sends a looping shot at goal, which beats the keeper and hits the back of the net. 
The forward, who moved back to the Spanish capital from Juventus last summer, has struggled for regular first-team action under Los Blancos boss Zinedine Zidane this season. Alvaro Morata catches the ball on the volley (Photo: Youtube) The stunning strike beats the keeper and hits the back of the net (Photo: Youtube) 
And his former club have reportedly joined Arsenal and Chelsea in the race to sign the unsettled striker, who spent two years on the books of the Old Lady. 
Spanish outlet Cadena Ser claim the forward will leave the Bernabeu at the end of the season if the French legend is still in charge. 
It is believed the forward, who has made 18 appearances for Spain, could command a fee of over Â£50million. The Spaniard may leave the Bernabeu at the end of the season (Photo: REUTERS) 
Morata, who was born in the Spanish capital, started his youth career at Atletico Madrid before moving to Getafe and then Los Blancos.
